Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of the government-approved immunity booster by stating that it can protect against the coronavirus.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the FDA has declared the product as unregistered and misleading.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove its effectiveness or safety.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the government approval automatically guarantees the product's efficacy.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanations being presented in the claim.
